title: Selling Sunset: Can buying homes really be that glamorous?
description: UK viewers are lapping up the glamour, drama and multi-million dollar homes in a hit TV show.

title: Pringles tube tries to wake from 'recycling nightmare'
description: Kellogg's redesigns the snackfood container that was dubbed the "number one villain" for recycling.

title: Astronomy Photographer of the Year 2020: Andromeda Galaxy image wins top prize
description: A photo of the Andromeda Galaxy has won this year's Astronomy Photographer of the Year Awards.

title: Quiz of the week: If Neil Buchanan is not Bansky, what is he doing now?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: The man who owned 3,000 cameras
description: One of the largest camera collections in the world is hidden away in a village hall in Fife.

title: Coronavirus: England's hotspots in maps
description: Localised data reveals the areas that saw the largest numbers of new cases in the past week

title: George Bizos obituary: Remembering Mandela's gentle but fierce lawyer
description: The South African champion of human rights remained active and outspoken into his tenth decade.

title: Investigation into US professor sparks debate over Chinese word
description: News of an investigation into a US university professor for using a Mandarin word reaches China.

title: Retracing final moments The Singapore Grip author's life
description: JK Farrell, the writer of ITV's upcoming drama series, drowned in 1979 while fishing in Ireland.

title: Former prisoner fighting for US criminal justice reform
description: Harvey Murphy's life changed when he was wrongly accused of stealing and later served time in jail for drug offences.

title: 'Scammer cloned my business on Instagram'
description: How a fake soap company attempted to clean out the bank accounts of followers.

title: Coronavirus: How technology could keep football fans safe at stadiums
description: Tech firms are working on solutions to enable fans to move safely outside, inside and around grounds.

title: Southampton boat shows cancelled over virus fears
description: Southampton's BOATS2020 and another show were expected to attract 20,000 visitors over 10 days.

title: Why black Americans are more likely to be vegan
description: African Americans are almost three times as likely to be vegan than white Americans.

title: US wildfires: San Francisco residents react to orange skies
description: The skies over San Francisco turn orange due to the smoke and dust created by nearby wildfires.

title: Premier League predictions: Lawro v soul singer and Arsenal fan Celeste
description: Mark Lawrenson takes on soul singer and Arsenal fan Celeste to make predictions for the opening weekend of the Premier League season.

title: Obituary: Dame Diana Rigg
description: The actress wore a cat suit in The Avengers, married James Bond and featured in Game of Thrones.

title: Stonehaven derailment: Report says climate change impact on railways 'accelerating'
description: A report into the fatal derailment near Stonehaven says the industry must improve its response to extreme weather.

title: Winchester school bus bridge crash leaves children injured
description: Pupils say they started screaming when the double-decker hit a railway bridge in Winchester.

title: Coronavirus: Maximum size of gatherings in Scotland cut to six
description: Plans to reopen theatres and live music venues are pushed back to October after a rise in coronavirus cases.

title: Coronavirus: No student parties and more online learning
description: New guidance requires universities to do all they can to limit the risk of outbreaks among students.

title: Coronavirus: New six people rule for 'no longer than we have to' - Hancock
description: The health secretary says England's new rule limiting social gatherings to six people is "vital".

title: Paris Musée d'Orsay sorry for barring visitor in low-cut dress
description: Student Jeanne describes her embarrassment at being stopped from going into the Musée d'Orsay in Paris.

title: Brexit: EU has 'serious concerns' ahead of emergency talks with UK
description: The EU calls for clarity over Boris Johnson's proposed changes to the Brexit Withdrawal Agreement.

title: Fans' return to stadiums in Scotland delayed until 5 October
description: The return of fans to Scottish sports stadiums is delayed until 5 October at the earliest, first minister Nicola Sturgeon has announced.

title: Sister Bliss of Faithless: Nightclubs and DJs 'left in the corner to rot'
description: Faithless musician and DJ Sister Bliss says the dormant dance music scene needs more protection.

title: Coronavirus: Long waits for hospital operations soar in England
description: More than two million people on the waiting list in England have been waiting more than 18 weeks.

title: Moria migrants: Greek ships to help shelter 13,000 after fire
description: Thousands of migrants sleep rough on the island of Lesbos after fire engulfs their squalid camp.

title: Coronavirus: Rees-Mogg self-isolating after child tested
description: The leader of the House of Commons was absent from business questions on Thursday.

title: British Airways owner IAG to cut more flights
description: BA has also reached the outline of a deal with the Unite union to end a bitter row over pay and job cuts.

title: Four-time champion Vettel to join renamed Aston Martin F1 team
description: Four-time world champion Sebastian Vettel is to join the renamed Aston Martin team in Formula 1 next year.

title: Liverpool 'cannot behave like Chelsea' in transfer market - Klopp
description: Manager Jurgen Klopp says Liverpool are "different" to some Premier League rivals in the transfer window as they are "not owned by countries or oligarchs".

title: US Open 2020: Serena Williams & Naomi Osaka target 2018 rematch
description: Serena Williams and Naomi Osaka will be hoping to secure a rematch of the 2018 US Open final when both semi-finals take centre stage on Thursday.

title: Black Cyclists Network: 'Why I thought this group was needed'
description: Mani Arthur was stopped and searched by the police last year during a ride to promote diversity.
